content.value_statement: This skill provides comprehensive security engineering capabilities for application security, threat modeling, and compliance auditing. It helps security professionals design secure architectures, implement proper cryptography, and automate security assessments across multiple technology stacks.
actual_capabilities: Create automated threat models with configurable templates and quality checks for software projects
Perform comprehensive security audits of codebases with deep analysis and recommendations
Design secure system architectures following industry best practices and compliance standards
Implement proper cryptographic solutions using AES-256, RSA, and secure key management
Apply security patterns for authentication, authorization, input validation, and audit logging
Generate security assessment reports with vulnerability findings and remediation guidance
limitations: Script templates require customization to implement specific security checks for your codebase
Automated tools cannot replace manual security reviews for complex vulnerability assessment
Penetration testing features require explicit authorization and proper legal scope
Cryptography implementation requires understanding of security principles and algorithm selection
Security audits depend on code quality and completeness of the target codebase

use_cases.title: Application Security Assessment
use_cases.description: Conduct comprehensive security audits of web applications, APIs, and mobile apps to identify and remediate vulnerabilities.

use_cases.title: Threat Modeling for Projects
use_cases.description: Create automated threat models for new software projects by identifying assets, threats, and security controls.

use_cases.title: Secure Architecture Design
use_cases.description: Design secure system architectures following zero-trust principles, defense in depth, and least privilege patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the security auditor to analyze the codebase at [path]. Run the analysis and provide a detailed report of critical and high-severity security findings with remediation recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Create Threat Model
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a threat model for [project name]. Identify assets, threat actors, attack vectors, and recommend appropriate security controls following STRIDE methodology.

prompt_templates.title: Design Security Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a secure architecture for [system description] following the security architecture patterns reference. Include authentication, authorization, input validation, and audit logging.

prompt_templates.title: Implement Cryptography
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement secure encryption for [data type] using industry-standard algorithms. Use AES-256-GCM for symmetric encryption and RSA-2048 or higher for asymmetric encryption with proper key management.

output_examples.input: Analyze my React application for security vulnerabilities
output: - Critical: Potential XSS in user input rendering (Component.js:45)
- High: Missing authentication on API endpoints (routes.js:12)
- Medium: Insecure CORS configuration allowing all origins
1. Sanitize all user inputs before rendering
2. Implement JWT-based authentication for API routes
3. Restrict CORS to specific allowed origins

output_examples.input: Design authentication for my mobile banking app
output: 1. OAuth 2.0 with PKCE flow for mobile clients
2. JWT access tokens (15 min expiry) with refresh tokens (7 days)
3. Secure token storage using iOS Keychain and Android Keystore
4. Biometric authentication (Face ID, Touch ID) for app unlock

output_examples.input: Create a threat model for my payment processing service
output: Assets: Payment card data, customer PII, transaction records
Threat Actors: External attackers, malicious insiders
Attack Vectors: API injection, man-in-the-middle, credential theft
Security Controls: TLS 1.3, tokenization, MFA, SIEM logging

best_practices: Validate and sanitize all user inputs to prevent injection attacks like SQL injection and XSS
Use parameterized queries or ORM frameworks for all database operations
Store passwords using strong hashing algorithms like bcrypt or Argon2 with unique salts
Implement HTTPS/TLS for all network communications and use certificate pinning in mobile apps
Follow the principle of least privilege for user permissions and service account access
anti_patterns: Hardcoding credentials, API keys, or secrets directly in source code
Using weak or deprecated cryptographic algorithms like MD5, SHA1, or DES
Trusting user input without validation or sanitization
Implementing custom cryptography instead of using established libraries

faq.question: How do I run a security audit on my codebase?
faq.answer: Run 'python scripts/security_auditor.py <target-path> --verbose' to analyze the target directory. The script performs analysis and generates a report with security findings.

faq.question: What permissions are needed for penetration testing?
faq.answer: You must have explicit written authorization before conducting any penetration tests. Use this skill only on systems you own or have proper legal scope to test.

faq.question: Which cryptographic algorithms should I use?
faq.answer: Use AES-256-GCM for symmetric encryption, RSA-2048 or higher for asymmetric encryption, SHA-256 for hashing, and bcrypt for password storage.

faq.question: How do I create a threat model?
faq.answer: Run 'python scripts/threat_modeler.py <project-path>' to generate a threat model. The tool identifies assets, threats, and recommends security controls.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: This skill supports TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, Swift, and Kotlin. It covers frameworks like React, Node.js, Express, and databases like PostgreSQL.

faq.question: How often should security audits be performed?
faq.answer: Run automated audits on every code commit or pull request. Conduct comprehensive manual audits quarterly and after major feature additions.
